titleStmt.title: J. M. Wilson to James F. Robinson
CWG7784

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Hawesville Ky 1st of Nov 62
Hon J. F. Robinson
Gov of Kentucky
Sir = In answer to Mr. Tates' communication of the 28th I would say that this is the 2nd Justices District of Hancock Co., and Mr. John McBrown has been elected Presiding Judge
I wish to be made Justice of the Peace in this District -- there is no Justice in town and it would be more convenient to the People to have at least one Justice in town as this is the County Seat

J. M. Wilson
Hawesville
For Appt of Justice of Peace
